p: The impact of radiotherapy on mucosal immunity was further explored using the aforementioned GSE103412 dataset. During radiotherapy, type I IFN antiviral gene expression transiently declined, but promptly recovered after radiotherapy. This is shown with SAMHD1 ( p < 0.05), which is involved in suppression of viral replication (Supplementary Fig. S2). There was a similar pattern of response with IFITM3; however, changes in IFITM3, MX1, and TRIM25 were not significant.
